source.fd32ed13:
def __load__data(__training_path, __test_path, concat=False):
	"""load data as input dataset
	params: __training_path: the training path of input dataset
	params: __test_path: the path of test dataset
	params: if it is True, then it will concatinate the training and test dataset as output
	returns: generate final loaded dataset as dataset, input and test
	"""
	# LOAD DATA
	import pandas as pd
	__train_dataset = pd.read_csv(__training_path, delimiter=',')
	__test_dataset = pd.read_csv(__test_path, delimiter=',')
	return __train_dataset, __test_dataset
__train_dataset, __test_dataset = __load__data(__training_path, __test_path, concat=True)
__train_dataset.head()
source.22b5b674:
# DISCARD IRRELEVANT COLUMNS
__train_dataset.drop(['id'], axis=1, inplace=True)
__test_dataset.drop(['id'], axis=1, inplace=True)
source.881b61ac:
# PREPROCESSING-1
import numpy as np
_NUMERIC_COLS_TO_SCALE = ['feat_1', 'feat_2', 'feat_3', 'feat_4', 'feat_5', 'feat_6', 'feat_7', 'feat_8', 'feat_9', 'feat_10', 'feat_11', 'feat_12', 'feat_13', 'feat_14', 'feat_15', 'feat_16', 'feat_17', 'feat_18', 'feat_19', 'feat_20', 'feat_21', 'feat_22', 'feat_23', 'feat_24', 'feat_25', 'feat_26', 'feat_27', 'feat_28', 'feat_29', 'feat_30', 'feat_31', 'feat_32', 'feat_33', 'feat_34', 'feat_35', 'feat_36', 'feat_37', 'feat_38', 'feat_39', 'feat_40', 'feat_41', 'feat_42', 'feat_43', 'feat_44', 'feat_45', 'feat_46', 'feat_47', 'feat_48', 'feat_49', 'feat_50', 'feat_51', 'feat_52', 'feat_53', 'feat_54', 'feat_55', 'feat_56', 'feat_57', 'feat_58', 'feat_59', 'feat_60', 'feat_61', 'feat_62', 'feat_63', 'feat_64', 'feat_65', 'feat_66', 'feat_67', 'feat_68', 'feat_69', 'feat_70', 'feat_71', 'feat_72', 'feat_73', 'feat_74', 'feat_75', 'feat_76', 'feat_77', 'feat_78', 'feat_79', 'feat_80', 'feat_81', 'feat_82', 'feat_83', 'feat_84', 'feat_85', 'feat_86', 'feat_87', 'feat_88', 'feat_89', 'feat_90', 'feat_91', 'feat_92', 'feat_93']
for _col in _NUMERIC_COLS_TO_SCALE:
    __train_dataset[_col] = np.log1p(__train_dataset[_col])
    if _col in __test_dataset:
        __test_dataset[_col] = np.log1p(__test_dataset[_col])
source.8f7e5ed4:
# MODEL
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
__model = LGBMClassifier()
__model.fit(__feature_train, __target_train) 
__y_pred = __model.predict_proba(__feature_test)

# SUBMISSION
submission = pd.DataFrame(columns=['id'], data=__test_dataset_submission_columns)
submission = pd.concat([submission, pd.DataFrame(__y_pred, columns=['Class_1', 'Class_2', 'Class_3', 'Class_4', 'Class_5', 'Class_6', 'Class_7', 'Class_8', 'Class_9'])], axis=1)

# Finding Intresting Datapoints Let's process each field by their histogram frequency and check if there is any intresting data point. source.f338ade5: ## Skewness In probability theory and statistics, skewness is a measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable about its mean. The skewness value can be positive, zero, negative, or undefined. More detail can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skewness) and the [Probability and Statistics Tables and Formulae](http://tomlr.free.fr/Math%E9matiques/Math%20Complete/Probability%20and%20statistics/CRC%20-%20standard%20probability%20and%20Statistics%20tables%20and%20formulae%20-%20DANIEL%20ZWILLINGER.pdf) by Zwillinger and Kokoska. Here are two samples Skewness data for positive and negative skew data. First, we we will calculate the skewness for each columns in Otto Group Product Classification Challenge Dataset if each selected column has positive float/integer values. Second, we will review the following conditions. - if $Skewness>1$ or $Skewness<-1$, we will consider it as highly skewed; - if $0.5 Column Skewness Skewness_Type 0 feat_1 12.900320 highly skewed 1 source.b60e7811:
# About Competition
The Otto Group is one of the world’s biggest e-commerce companies, with subsidiaries in more than 20 countries. We are selling millions of products worldwide every day, with several thousand products being added to our product line.
 A consistent analysis of the performance of our products is crucial. Due to our diverse global infrastructure, many identical products get classified differently. Therefore, the quality of our product analysis depends heavily on the ability to accurately cluster similar products.Competition file is available [here](https://www.kaggle.com/c/otto-group-product-classification-challenge).
source.9c0886a3: ### Target Column We need to predict the target column. Therefore, we need to detach the target column in prediction. Note that if we don't drop the field, it will generate a model with high accuracy on training and worst accuracy on test (because the value in test dataset is Null). Here is the list of *target column*: target
source.02482e75: We need to predict the probabilities for each group, therefore we will use predict_proba() features that generates probability for each group.
